Reviews.Title: “The Full Guest Experience”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: I had a room reservation here and it was my first time to the Dallas area. I called ahead with a number of questions and Chuck Hernandez made me feel confident in his staff well prior to arrival. I arrived on an extremely busy day but was accommodated with an early check-in due to my priority club membership (I recommend everyone join!) As for the stay itself, I was extremely impressed with the helpfulness of the staff, specifically Chuck and Jorge. Housekeeping was excellent as well and for the first time in many times, I did not experience any issues. I think attentiveness of the staff and their extraordinary hospitality played a large part in making my stay one of the best in recent recollection. Hotel has a pool and jacuzzi as well which is a rare find these days!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Well-Maintained”
Reviews.Author: Paul Y
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the CPD while working at a multi-day non-profit fundraiser. The room was very clean and constantly maintained. Any and all requests of the staff were quickly fulfilled and always with a smile. It was such a nice experience and a relief knowing that my lodging needs were being met and I could return after a long-day to a clean room with a comfortable bed. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “TBRU Hosting”
Reviews.Author: Marcus H
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Very friendly. Went the extra mile to make sure everybody was satisfied. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience at one of the most accommodating hotels”
Reviews.Author: Stephen K
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Crowne Plaza the last two years when attending TBRU. For a hotel to go above and beyond the call of duty is always a major plus in my opinion. For a hotel to accommodate the likes of thousands of big hairy men in such a professional manner is outstanding. Great rooms, great facilities for all. Conveniently located to many of the attractions Dallas has to offer. Two Great BIG Thumbs Up. I didn't take advantage of the breakfast, so I can't rate it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Good Rates, Exc Service”
Reviews.Author: Keith W
Reviews.Content: Started with a phone call. Joseph B. answered as was more helpful than what you might be used to. A friendly and helpful person on the other end brightens your day even if it had been a challenging one. I had to deal with some court issues there in Dallas â€“ not a favorite thing for any one, so, I just wasnâ€™t in the greatest of moods to have to spend my hard earned money on a hotel close to the courts. Surprisingly, I found that the rates at Crowne were quite reasonable plus you still get the five-star treatment. When you are in town and need to be close to the action, give Crowne a call and ask for Joseph B â€“ youâ€™ll be glad you did. Thanks Joseph.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: greenmtntrail
Reviews.Content: Before I went to Dallas on business, I was concerned about the accomodations because I am allergic to perfumes. This includes ones in soaps, cleaners, detergents, etc. If they are used in room cleaning, I am in trouble. Well, I called ahead and spoke with the Guest Services Manager, Chuck Hernandez. He was very accomodating. He made a note on his computer and got with the room services manager the day before. They worked very hard to make sure my room was perfume free! They did a great job too! When I arrived, I was greated by, Kenneth Price, he is very nice! I was concerned about the chair in my room, and he arranged to get me another one... I am a person of size and the chair arms were very narrow and uncomfortable. That night for supper, I went to the hotel restaurant. My server, Diane, was so nice! I am not accostumed to traveling alone, and therefore it was nice to have a friendly face in a very nice restaurant. The food was excellent! The next night the head over the restaurant came to my table. I was sitting with new friends, I had met at the meeting I was attending. He spoke to us, asked how all was going and was very plesant! The food was outstanding! I hear they have a new chef... great job. The breakfast buffet has eggs, waffles, pancakes, etc. cooked to order on a flat grill... delicious. The shuttle driver/bellmen were all very nice... They worked hard and gave me excellent directions to places I was driving. Including which lane I should be in, etc. My only negative was one time when we had to wait a while because traffic had caused our shuttle driver to be late. (I actually think it was because the group before us was not all ready on time to leave and caused a problem, but they said it was traffic.) I suggest a couple of benches outside the building for people to sit on while waiting. The building is nice, has beautiful grounds, close free parking, and shuttle service, accomodating staff, comfortable beds, quiet zoned floors, indoor pool and spa, exercise room, and gift shop. The furniture in my room was a little scratched. I only include the couple of negatives so you will know I am being upfront. This is a wonderful place to stay. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alisha K
Reviews.Content: I fly into Dallas weekly and have been staying here since February, I absolutely LOVE this hotel. The rooms are great, the beds are comfortable, and the quiet zone is perfect. All of the employees that I've come in contact with are excellent. The front desk personnel truly show great professionalism, they go out of their way to make you feel welcome. I personally want to thank Ruth and Betty for the wonderful and friendly service they provide. You can tell it's truly genuine. The front desk managers Kenneth and Chuck are the best. Since this is kind of like my home away from home these guys have bent over backwards to ensure that I am truly happy here. The shuttle drivers, Rolando, Emanuel, and Shawn are extremely friendly, and are more than willing to assist. Another thing I love about this hotel is that every Wednesday they have an appreciation gathering for their platinum members. That in itself states a whole, especially in the hotel industry. I Love the free WI-FI in every room. To me this hotel is a 5 star, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay and awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: Tommy A
Reviews.Content: Stay for about a week to setup and attend a large group event (TBRU) the hotel was sold out and the staff was incredible about making my and the attendees stays great. Chuck Hernandez and his crew at the front desk were amazing. They check in guest and worked well with our team to help make our event memorial. Chuck helped our vendors with recieving and shiping their products before and after the event. Sharlonda Manning--what can i say but two words--Super Woman. She help prior to the event to make sure things ran smoothly throughout the weekend. She was there during the weekend to resolve issues if the arose and provided solutions that were in the best of our team and our attendees. Manual and his team from banquets helped the whole event without any issues. They were attentive to our needs and curtious to our guest. There was always someone around that i could get a hold up if there was something that needed attendtion. We had 1704 attendees for our event this year and all were impressed with how the hotel handled the large group with ease. Every attendee that i talked to that had interactions with the hotel stay stated the hotel staff was friendly and respectful. Many mention that they havent been to another event where the staff embraced our attendees so easily. my thanks to all of the hotel staff for making this TBRU one of our biggest and best.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Covarrubio
Reviews.Content: I have been to the TBRU event hosted at the Crowne Plaza for several years, each year the hotel seems to get better and better. This year I was greeted by Becki (I hope I spelled this correctly) who greeted us with such enthusiasm and a bright smile. I wanted a king size bed so bad but knew the hotel was out of them but no matter how much I bothered Becki for one she kept a great attitude and a wonderful tone and demeanor towards us. The grounds were always clean and the staff was always very friendly and polite. My only concern with the hotel is that we had to ask 3 times for fresh towels over a 4 hour time period before we finally made the trip to the lobby to get them ourselves and we had to ask 2 times for our room to be cleaned but once we let Becki know that we had called she got right on it and it was cleaned within 15 minutes. While the 2 instances were not exciting to deal with Becki truly made the experience fun and professional and her attitude and energy overshadowed those 2 small details.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: artesp
Reviews.Content: Very nice and very good service and all Hotel employee were very, very nice. I would stay there again when in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Daniel B
Reviews.Content: I was there for a group and have to say that the staff did a fantastic job! The front desk was always more than friendly and was very knowledgable. This was my second stay at this hotel and I would stay again. Kudos to the hotel and staff for pulling off one fantastic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Staff was super attentive and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend as part of a large group (TBRU). The hotel was sold out and the staff was really pushed to the limit, but they still remained super friendly and very helpful. I had a problem with my TV and called the front desk and someone was there to fix it in less than 5 minutes. I was amazed. It is an older property, but everything was clean and well kept and the rooms were nice. Great location and very reasonable rates. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster weekend”
Reviews.Author: lukekMcGuire
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for a competition weekend for my daughter. The hotel was sold out. What went wrong: 1. toilet didn't flush. They "fixed" it and we could use it for non solid waste only. Sold out hotel, no open rooms we were stuck. 2. requested a trashcan day one received it day 3. 3. ran out of towels and the hotel had no clean towels to give us. 4. ran out of hot water, no towels+no hot water=no shower 5. Room never cleaned. When it was cleaned we did not get clean towels. Took some from the pool area. 5. ran out of ice 6. ran out of tortillias 7. hassled people about drinking their own beer and eating food they brought in the lobby but only had one bar tender and no food. No possible way to even assist their guests but still did not permit them to take matters into their own hands. Expected us to eat in our rooms no one cleaned, over flowing tiny trashcan, and a toilet that did not flush. 8. Checking people into the hotel knowing they had just told us they had no idea when or if they would have hot water. Watching the desk staff not mention it to anyone checking in to make sure they even wanted to risk it. This was particularly sad because the kids they were checking in were on their way to basic training and this hotel would be their last civilian experience. Luckily by 10 pm hot water had returned. Several people from our group checked out and left. What went right: 1.They credited several people for one night of their stay so they could go somewhere else. 2. Free wifi 3. nice free breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Regretfully Cannot Recommend”
Reviews.Author: msim42
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel with a large group. We are Priority Club members and was shocked by this hotel. 95% of the hotel staff were courteous and seemed like they were trying to make things right, but we will not return. It was just too stressful of a stay. 1. Check in was fine. 2. No housekeeping for two of our three nights. Had to beg for towels. Front desk did not seem sympathetic. Finally after several calls and threatening to walk down to the desk in my bed sheet or naked and wet, towels arrived. Toilet paper was also not replaced. 3. Ran out of hot water on our second day. The front desk sent someone within an hour and fixed the problem, but the hot water was gone again within two hours. I did not call back - just endured it. Our sink and tub would also stop up intermittently, but drained on their own after a few hours. 4. Wifi is hit and miss, but it's free, so you really can't complain about that. 5. Most of the front desk workers were unable to answer questions about directions and area businesses/restaurants. 6. Went to the restaurant at 12:05pm on a Saturday. After 55 minutes, only a third of our party had received their food. After cancelling our orders due to time constraints, the waiter came running out with our order, but most of it was incorrect. They left with our glasses to get refills, but only a few of them came back. Our checks were incorrect, but again, due to time constraints had to guesstimate the total and left cash on the table for hopefully the correct amount. There were only four other tables in the restaurant at that time, and some received their food that had come in after us. We did not order anything special - burgers, soup, etc. No lunch for the diabetic that day. 7. The business center was a nice touch and you could make free copies, but the computers and pringers functional ability was hit and miss also. 8. Room keys stopped functioning several times during our stay. 9. Driver of the free shuttle was nice, but only used on our first day because he warned us that the service may not be available because their schedule was full. It should also be noted that there is nothing but a Jack in the Box and a Shell station is safe walking distance. You definitely need a car if the shuttle's schedule is full. Don't get me wrong, I don't want to complain, but I do not want anyone to have to endure the issues that we did. It seemed like they meant well, but just couldn't pull it off. They comped full nights to other members of our group, but I had to ask and only got 50% off of one night. The building, while old, is perfectly fine to look at (not including plumbing issues). Will not return.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Diego M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK for its price. The service in the restaurant and the roomservice weren`t very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: murmagmazy
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this hotel. Free Wifi, nice people, and clean rooms make this hotel a great deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lucas s
Reviews.Content: The staff is very knowledgeable and expeirenced. Its proximity to downtown and Love field and the shuttle service is exceptional. It is a little outdated but that is more than made up for by the clean and sanitary condition of the whole property. It is a place that you can feel secure. You are getting good return on money spent at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, reasonable price, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hrmatsui
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Crowne Plaza and it was beyond my expectations. Although the place looks like a little bit old, the rooms are very well maintained, they look like new, clean and spacious. LCD TV, digital a/c, wifi, etc. Also, the staff was always very helpful an kind to me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Cherrice
Reviews.Content: Every property has trade offs and this is no exception. The facilities are older but fairly well maintained. Rooms run to the small side but are adequate with a comfortable bed. Determine your need for heat or A/C early as the system is old and rusted and the engineer - very responsive - can give you one or the other but not both. My room had breakfast included which was a full breakfast and very good. They do have a local shuttle, which the only draw back was the front desk clerk failed to pass on our pick up call and we waited for over an hour to finally get a lift back. That only happened once - they were especially attentive to pick up times after that experieince.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, 2 star quality at best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinns
Reviews.Content: Non smoking room reeks of smoke and it's really bad when the ancient air conditioning unit is running. Very old tv, sandpaper sheets on an uncomfortable bed and shady location. The staff are so wonderful, it is a shame the hotel isn't as nice as they are. I will not stay here again. Worst night of non-sleep in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: Timberlynn O
Reviews.Content: The negative: My experience is that the reception desk is supposed to treat you with respect. When I handed her my booking info and requested a queen or king size bed, she replied ... Sorry you booked through Priceline, you should have confirmed through them. On Friday 12-30-11, I called the hotel personally (bc Priceline advices you have to speak directly to the hotel) and asked and the person advised I had to request it upon check in. I arrived to check in 15 minutes early to assure we have a large enough bed. After I accepted the double beds (bc she said that was all that was available).. So my husband and I will now have to sleep separately, I asked her if we could go ahead and request a larger bed for tomorrow and she told me no... She was rude.. The hotel is VERY dated.. We travel often and have used Priceline numerous times.. The Positive: The bartenders were great, both Saturday and Sunday evening.. They were nice and professional. Also the shuttle driver was awesome! He was very nice and showed us where to go.. So thank you! But overall I wouldnt go back and stay if it was free..

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: perimeter285
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated hotel. Good service. Clean rooms. Decent location. Got a great deal on Hotwire. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Crown Dallas Market Center”
Reviews.Author: 19tom48
Reviews.Content: Every thing was very good. A older hotel but very clean and the people that work there are very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good property little negative to say...”
Reviews.Author: texlawdog
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in the past two weeks, visiting a relative at the hospital. First, the bad stuff, we ordered room service on a Saturday morning, an hour later my wife calls and cancels the order. The first time, we had a king size bed, a microwave and a fridge. The second time, neither the fridge or microwave. Why not be consistent? Positives... Free wi-fi, bar and restaurant on site that is ok. This is a great property. Our experiences likely were staff related and not that big a deal and probably not easily corrected. We booked this property on Priceline, we would stay here again! All staff was very nice and helpful... Just a couple minor bad things.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel - Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: tjfoley
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we opened our room to find a full size bed. This was billed as a standard room. I called down to the front desk and told them that there was no way we would fit. The clerk said "No problem, come down and we'll have new key cards for you". It was as simple as that - we were put into a king size bed/suite room. While there is a restaurant on site, we did not try it. The pool was indoors, small and too cold for us. We tried the hot tub and wished it was HOT - not tepid. Free parking was good, and location was convenient for getting on 35E.

Reviews.Title: “good value & location”
Reviews.Author: Runnin26
Reviews.Content: staff was friendly, parking is cheap by comparison for downtown, excellent location, good beds, room was very clean

Reviews.Title: “Quick Quotes Private Reserve”
Reviews.Author: dabby52
Reviews.Content: Using a ballroom for a scrapbooking weekend worked OK again this year. Catered Saturday lunch was cold and late; Sunday was better. Room for two with king bed was roomy, but AC not enough; connecting to double room, which was small, hot, no hot water and worse service.

Reviews.Title: “Underwelming”
Reviews.Author: Brandi B
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read some of the reviews on this site before our office decided to come to Dallas for a weekend getaway to Medieval Times. We looked at the pictures on the Crowne Plaza website and they made the hotel look WAY better than it actually was. #1- We had several children with us that were looking forward to swimming in the pool. Your indoor pool was way smaller than the picture made it appear online and it was freezing! (We thought it was supposed to be heated) and so the kids really didn't want to swim. They kept going to the hot tub. I also just want to say that you might want to put some kind of traction surface down on the tile between the hot tub and the pool as i saw many guests slip and fall. It's a lawsuit waiting to happen. #2- I also saw some shady characters hanging around the premises. #3- It's 2011, can you get rid of the 1992 25" tube televisions? All of the nice places I've stayed have updated their TV's to the flat screens. #4- Our room was clean, but when we went to the ice machine ( on the 11th floor) there was a ton of rust and corrosions on the top. It looked kinda gross and made me wonder what I had in my drinking glass. #5- The lobby was nice and I did appreciate the free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home for me.”
Reviews.Author: zoomblur
Reviews.Content: This is one of the three or four hotels in the area that I stay at very regularly. I like the location, and generally the staff is pretty friendly--although I must say that other than checking in and out, I haven't had to deal with staff very often, which is to say that not much goes wrong here. This is my favorite hotel in the area, primarily because of the rooms which are always very comfortable and most importantly, clean. The restaurant and bar are very near the lobby and are always filled with guests having a great time, and the food is pretty good. The elevators are very fast--an important element to those of us who need to get out of the hotel quickly in the mornings. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and will probably run into you on one of my many future stays here.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: KGod76
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group of 30 women for one night at the Crowne Plaza on Friday, August 26 for WOF. Check in was smooth & they held our bags for us while we went to our activities at the AAC. Our group had rooms on the 12th floor. The room was a little hot when we arrived, but we turned the dial down & it cooled off nicely. The room was spacious with two nice sitting chairs & another chair at the desk. The walls were covered in wall paper that was peeling off in spots. The beds were small (full sized), but there was just two of us so it didnâ€™t matter. We didnâ€™t use the tv, so cannot comment on it. Finding ice took us to 3 floors & the vending machines only took credit cards. The hotel made dinner for our group that night that included salad, chicken, potatoes, veggies, rolls, & dessert. All of it was really good for a hotel food. The next morning, the shower was extremely strong and felt so good. The bathroom had some small areas of mildew. Breakfast was more than just cereals & breads; it included an omelet maker who could also make pancakes & other grill items. This was a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel that has good service and good rate.”
Reviews.Author: imascant
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the last few days of business travel. The good... Location is pretty good if you need to get on / off I35. Centrally located. We got extra points for our stay. Staff was friendly. The bad... Hot. We were on the top floor, big room. Unfortunately, Dallas is in the middle of a crazy heat wave which made our west facing room hot. This is an older hotel. As such, expect some things to be dated

Reviews.Title: “Fine for one night airport stay!”
Reviews.Author: dsg560
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through a discount hotel service. Parking was ample and worked for us. We wanted a king room, but they only had doubles left however that was not a big deal. Room was nice, very clean and had a great view. The room smelled nice, furnishings were clean and the bed had nice sheets and was comfy. The wallpaper needs to be replaced, however...the location, comfort and cleanliness makes it perfect for a one night stop over. Soooo close to Love Field too!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Crowne Plaza ever!”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle_Bode
Reviews.Content: As Platinum members we have travelled all over the US and Europe, but this was by far the worst stay ever. Our stay began with the unprofessional check-in where we were not even recognized as Platinum members. One of the room packages we had booked included breakfast, but did not show up on the computer system at the front desk. We were told that we would have to go to the Exec Business Center and print it out before they would recognize that breakfast was included in that room. After printing it out and returning to the front desk to make sure that we would not be charged for breakfast, my husband didn't even receive an apology for the mix up and inconvenience of having to do everything himself to prove that we the breakfast was included in our booking. Once we arrived in our room, which had a wonderful view over Dallas, we realized there was no safe deposit box in our room. We were told to come to the front desk to deposit our valuable, but at the front desk my husband was rudely dismissed and passed on to someone else. The front desk clerk told him he was too busy to help him. That is not customer service. The hotel had apparently been "recently" renovated and the interior is quite nice. The housekeeping staff could do a much better job of keeping everything in good order if they would do more than just the basic cleaning. The front of the dresser with the TV didn't look like it had ever seen furniture polish or a cleaning cloth. It was full of palm prints. We wanted to take a picture of the Dallas skyline, but we had to first clean the window because it was full of palm prints and head prints. The door frame in the bathroom looked like it had blood smears or who know what. The duct for the A/C was absolutely filthy. The A/C in our room was not working adequately, and can only be controlled by what looks like the original A/C controls from when the hotel was built. This should have been upgraded to a digital system along with the renovations. The floors in and around the elevators on the Executive Floor had papers, toothpicks, etc. which no one had bothered to clean up. The bathtubs are rather slippery and we phoned down for a rubber bath mat to be brought up. On the first try, a full size mattress and box spring were delivered. We explained again what we needed, and on the second try a full size refrigerator was delivered. On the third try, and English speaking gentleman came to the door with someone from Housekeeping who only spoke Spanish. We explained again what we needed and were told that they didn't have anything like that. About an hour later, a rubber bath mat was delivered. When we were removing the plastic wrap around the mat, the whole thing disintegrated. We were able to poke wholes through the mat. It also looked as if it had been around since the opening of the hotel. I brought it back down to the front desk to ensure that we would not be charged for it and she just laughed and shook her head. We filled in the questionnaire that was in our hotel room, and put it in an envelope marked with the name of the hotel manager Jeff Woods. We handed this in to the front desk staff when we checked out, but weeks later we still have not heard anything from him. The only redeeming grace of this hotel was the Room Service and Restaurant staff. They were the only ones who were friendly and attentive during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price.”
Reviews.Author: yellowjacket987
Reviews.Content: My husband had a meeting in the area and was able to get a special rate. Otherwise we probably would have not stayed here. The suite we were in was HUGE. However, the bed linens had not been changed or sugar type crystals were spilled under the covers. They did move us to another room, but it had no TV remote control and was stale smelling. Another couple we met said their room A/C did not work and had to wait 3 hours for it to be repaired. There is a bar and restaurant on site, but we did not go there. If you want something nice to eat be prepared to drive, as there are just a few fast food places nearby. They do offer a shuttle within a 5 mi radius.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kartravel_1107
Reviews.Content: I felt the hotel provided excellent customer service. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Hotel restaurant was very accomodating and the hotel staff as a whole were pleasant and ready to serve. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: coltsfan54
Reviews.Content: I had a business conference scheduled at the Crowne Plaza in July 2011. The hotel staff was very friendly. The hotel was very easy to find and I was able to park my rental car in the hotel garage quite easily. I would stay there again if traveling to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: M1H
Reviews.Content: Great service and definitely sign up for the preferred customer/points program.

Reviews.Title: “Beginning to feel like home”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo50
Reviews.Content: Nothing overly fancy here, just great hotel service, nice clean and quiet rooms and a great value. I've stayed at this hotel three times the past six months and have always found the front desk staff to be friendly without being "fake". I feel like they genuinely want to make my stay there pleasant. The rooms are nice, especially where it counts: cleanliness, quiet and nice comfortable bed. Not overly spacious but okay for one or two people. The breakfast is incredible, an omelet bar with a full buffet, included in your stay? Not bad at all. My work takes me to UTSWMC and this general area, which is a plus, so the location, hotel room price and amenities are a bargain for me. If you are looking for a hotel in this area, check these guys out, the hotel staff will try their best to make your stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrades Needed to Compete”
Reviews.Author: ZephyrTexas
Reviews.Content: Platinum Priority perqs are minimal at this serviceable hotel. A platinum-level guest receives $10 worth of chips that can be used for drinks or meals at the hotel. Not $10/day, but $10 no matter how long the stay is for. Like many Texas Crowne Plazas, this one has a deal with the US Military to house enlistees. However, unlike other Crowne Plazas, for some reason (probably due to ease of billing) this one segregates its dining room to keep military and civilian guests separate. This practice is somewhat disconcerting. And for some reason there were flies in the dining room each evening. Another downside of the hotel is the technology level of the rooms. The TV was a blurry 32" cathode ray tube affair. The alarm clock was the ancient Sony Dream Machine which is just as hard to program for an alarm as it was fifteen years ago. The plus side of the hotel is its convenience to Love Field and the good cheer of the dining room waitstaff.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: dhollier
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Market Center in Dallas on a business trip. Not only was the room large and comfortable, but it had a refrigerator and microwave. The front desk associates were very helpful in getting me a ride nearby and the sales manager saw that there was a line when I was checking in and went behind the front desk to give me my key. I had dinner in the restaurant which was very good and lunch (try the Vintner) was great for a light bite.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet”
Reviews.Author: iknowwhatisnice
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to get away from the family and relax I would recommend this hotel. However, if you are relaxing to get away and stay in the room to watch tv, this is NOT the hotel. The TV was the worst for me. My whole purpose was to stay in the room and watch TV. You could barely read the guide on the TV to see whats on. Overall, it was nice and clean but being that this is mainly for business people, I see the TV is their least concern. I went twice two weekends in a row and still overall liked it.. MINUS my main purpose was the TV.

Reviews.Title: “Thankfully not all Crowne Plaza's were created equally...”
Reviews.Author: tinabinab
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend a quick night away from home this past weekend, so I Pricelined a room in the Market Center area. We had plans to go to Medieval Times, which is over an hour away from our home. I stayed at another Crowne Plaza just a few nights ago in California and had a horrible experience. So I was less than thrilled about getting another Crowne Plaza hotel. Fortunately we discovered that not all Crowne Plaza's are the same. Check in - The lady checking us in was very pleasant and efficient. Our Room - Our room was a double overlooking the front of the hotel and the freeway. The recent refurbishment of the hotel was evident in everyway. The room was well appointed and the beds quite comfy. Pool - This location has a nice sized indoor pool. It was being enjoyed by quite a few guests. Wish we could have arrived sooner and enjoyed it as well. Parking - Parking was free. Yay! The hotel seemed to be quite full, but we had no trouble finding satisfactory parking. Lobby Bar - Having noticed a bar off the lobby when we were checking in, we invited our fellow dinner companions back to the hotel for a drink. The bar was pretty busy, and you had to get your own drinks (no waitstaff), but we really enjoyed ourselves. The drinks were nice and tasty and the bar / dining area was comfortable and not so loud that you couldn't enjoy conversation. Checkout - No surprises at checkout, other than a friendly face. Overall we were pleased with this Crowne Plaza and would be happy to have a reason to return.

Reviews.Title: “Would not consider it a 3 1/2 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sabbatia
Reviews.Content: We only had a few issues. First, when you ask where the hot tub is at the front desk, it would be really nice if they would let you know it was out of order also instead of letting you walk there to find it out for yourself. OH and the smell in the front desk and lobby....kinda smelled like pee would be the best I could describe. Think, walking into a nursing home. Bad smells are an easy fix and I hope they take care of it soon. The other problem we had was no hot water in the shower. There is nothing like waking up and taking a nice lukewarm shower to get your day started. I had no issues with the room. They were plain but clean....and the bartender was really, really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but neighborhood a bit sketchy and hotel showing its age”
Reviews.Author: puzzolente
Reviews.Content: Big selling point for this hotel is its proximity to Love Field and I-35, but that comes at the price of an iffy-feeling neighborhood. We got hit up for "gas money" by a guy cruising the parking lot in a pickup within moments of coming back from dinner. Clientele seemed to be a few biz travelers, but also a lot of 20-somethings milling about for whatever reason. I didn't feel unsafe, but I don't know that I'd send my wife and kid here alone. On the plus side: About 3 miles from Love Field, convenient to downtown and uptown areas. Huge rooms with great A/C, decent bed. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice details such as free wireless internet and electrical outlets in lamp bases (no need to crawl around under the desk to charge your stuff). Decent cheap breakfast buffet with an omelette station. Negatives: Neighborhood and clientele appeared a bit sketchy. Slightly dingy and dated feeling in hallways and bathroom. Weak shower, no trash can in sight in bathroom. Coworker awoke to find her room service order still hanging on her door. $159 single/king base price felt a bit steep for what we got and what else is available for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: EricLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Bed and TV are both at least 10 years old Breakfast was horrible Rooms in desperate need of updating Indifferent service Located next to noisy freeway

Reviews.Title: “Love the pet-friendliness!”
Reviews.Author: Tinywife
Reviews.Content: Huuby & I brought our little Maltese puppy with us for our stay Jan 14-16, 2011, during a martial arts conference. We enjoyed everything about our stay, especially the friendly staff, who were always ready with a smile as they saw us strolling through the lobby with our little pup. We were pleased to note that our dog was widely welcomed & we felt quite well accommodated. Our room, while a bit dated, was clean & tidy; we enjoyed a lovely view & the quiet of the 20th floor made coming in at night feel relaxing. Staff were all quite helpful & friendly, though we had to call & check up on our laundry service in order to ensure timely delivery of our clothing for our next day's activities. Excellent value for room, amenities & service, overall. The hot tub was an especially nice amenity for my husband after he'd had a long day of training on the mat, & was looking to soothe sore muscles. This represented our first stay as Proirity Club members, & we are excited to book our next trip with the Crowne Plaza family.Bravo to the Market Center Staff; we look forward to staying with you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location, and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kenjim72
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. Breakfast restaurant staff was great, and the chef made me the best omelette I've had in a long time. He was very kind and polite to everyone, and brought their made to order breakfast to them very quickly with a smile -- a nice way to start the day. Rooms were comfortable and roomy, and bed linens were new and clean. Only thing missing was the kit with ear plugs, pillow spray, and other stuff that I thought was standard at Crowne Plazas. We have a corporate rate, and for what we paid, was a great value. Other members of our management team stay there often -- I see why. Great location -- right next to I-35 and easy access to many good restaurants. Will definitely stay there again. Heard they have a great Priority Club reception on Wednesdays.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel near I-35”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: If you just need a place to sleep, you will be fine here. The freeway noise is loud, so ask for a room on the other side of the hotel. We had a small double room with a small bathroom. I was surprised to see the old 26 inch tube television from back in the '80's. We did have HBO which I enjoyed. Two of the lampshades had tears in them. There was one window in the room overlooking the freeway. Everything was clean and in working order. On their website they say you will receive "sleep amenities" consisting of earplugs, lavender linen spray, a sleep blindfold and a CD with sleep tips...none of this was in our room. Neither were there nightlights in the bath, as advertised on the website. Not a total deal-breaker, but they should not be advertised if they don't include them. One positive is that the pool was heated to a nice temperature. There was also free parking which seems to be rare in Dallas these days. We stayed at the Crowne Plaza downtown and enjoyed it much better.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly, but misleading on pet fees.”
Reviews.Author: BandB03
Reviews.Content: I'm in the process of a move and was traveling with my two dogs. I am a Priority Club member and decided to use my points to stay at a Priority Club hotel. When I called I asked about the pet policy. I was told that it was $50. I then asked if that was total or per pet. I was told total. However, when I arrived I was charged $100 due to having two pets. I was a little upset because I could have stayed at another pet friendly hotel for the same price and not lost 25,000 points. I also thought that the front desk staff was slightly rude when I checked in. I understand that some people don't pick up after their pets, however, when I left my room, it would have been difficult to tell that two big dogs had been there. I do want to say that the technician that came to fix the phone and supply me with a remote control for the TV was exceptionally nice. It's not a bad hotel. Just beware the pet policy. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for people traveling with their pets, but it's fine for non-pet travelers.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but two service problems in 3 day stay”
Reviews.Author: dabby52
Reviews.Content: Four women in one room to save funds; one slept on blow up bed. Maids DID NOT replace duvet cover on to bed, left it on the floor under upturned blow up. One of occupants had ordered oxygen for a health problem; she TALKED to the man who was delivering it. Took three or four phone calls and a days delay to get the delivery to our room. Reservation made for 4; only three sets of towels when we got there. More brought without a problem. Food service meals twice during the retreat; food and set up were EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: luckyokguy
Reviews.Content: Bought on price line. Very large comfortable room. Mine was a corner room which may be why it was so large. No fridge or microwave, but they will bring one up to your room if they have available on request. Close to market center. They have a shuttle, but you really need a car. Parking and internet were free but that may be a priority club perk, not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Dated furnishings and style, but great service from limited staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gringoscazu
Reviews.Content: Too many signs of the building's age remain. AC was substandard. Free internet was nice, but not as strong a signal as I needed. The desk was small and the TV old. Two queens take up too much of the space, and the closet is just totally useless. Left us with too little room to prepare for our departure. If you need space to organize your "stuff" that you bought while in Big D, then try to stay elsewhere. Although they were understaffed, someone ALWAYS made an effort to assist with anything we needed. The sincere concern for our satisfaction almost made up for the shortage. The bellman "didn't show up" for work on the morning of our departure. While they went out of their way to help with our 11 suitcases, it seemed like a hotel of this size and airport location should have more than one bellman working on weekdays. Again, however, this is not to discount the well above average effort of the staff to assist us with what would have been a disaster without some help. I'm going to check the "thumbs up" button because of the staff and Priceline-provided value, but I can't recommend it at listed rates until the place is updated and they hire more employees. The non-smoking policy should also be enforced. There were people smoking on our floor, and it permeated the common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Looks just like the picture- which is why tripadvisor is needed.”
Reviews.Author: living≤arnin
Reviews.Content: I always check with tripadvisor before I travel or reserve a room...always. I have never been disappointed with Trip Advisor. I liked the idea that the hotel staff took the time to respond to the posts here...it means they care about their facility which is always a good thing. The facility itself was clean without bad odors. The pool and exercise equipment looked nice and clean. The staff was friendly, multicultural, and multilingual as others have reported. The furniture was fairly new after a remodel...scratched but still new looking and up-to-date. The standard room had plenty of space to sit with 3 comfortable chairs and 1 desk. I loved the view of downtown in the distance. There was just something about my room that seemed lacking. The bathtub was stained from what was probably old slip resistant stick-ons. I traveled solo, but booked the room for 2 adults and 2 children-- but there were only 3 bath towels. The bed looked like it was hastily made. The bed linen on one bed was not neatly tucked in which gave the appearance...well travelers want to think no one else slept in their bed :-) so when linen is not neatly tucked...some of us question why especially in such a nice hotel. The other posts were accurate except the equipment has been updated. The staff was professional and friendly from the pool area to the dining room. The made-to-order omelets were great and the dining room staff did a great job not only for me but others. They were especially kind to another family traveling with young children. The orange juice was a bit sour so just try it before you drink a big gulp like I did. The indoor pool area appeared clean and neat as did the exercise area. The operator button on the phone did not work when I wanted to ask for help because the remote on the TV did not work. I decided to go to bed early. There is a Starbucks one block north on the West side of the highway. There is a regular shuttle to Love Field. If you are stuck there all week, you are close to some great places...but there is no where to walk other than Starbucks, and the area is not appealing to sightseeing. The parking is free and plentiful but only a little is near the front door. The one resident smoking outside in her pajamas at the front door sitting on the guard posts left the impression that some people obey the no smoking rules which I appreciated. The next night I stayed at a sister facility a few stars less and everything was clean, neat, new looking and the remote worked. The prices were about the same. The 3 1/2 stars for this facility may be misleading because people are expecting more than a regular Holiday Inn, and it is more. This is a Holiday Inn with an indoor poor and on-site dining that looks really nice after the upgrades, but still shows its age. Like getting an expensive facelift, but the neck still shows signs of age. Major overhauls take time. The rates are reasonable, but...try to get a better deal and you won't feel like you lost out when you run into glitches. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Above average staff, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Grandpa_Tex
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay, nothing to brag about but nothing to condem. There was a free shuttle to and from the airport (Love Field). Im not sure if you could take the shuttle to other destinations as my stay was spent at the convention center and there was no need to take the shuttle anywhere else. If not you will need a car because there is only one small convience store close and nothing else within walking distance. I found the staff helpfull and courtious, the hostess in the resturant was very nice and attentive. The room was older but still in good shape, the air conditioning worked, the tv was ok. The room was very quite. Best: Free shuttle, good staff Worst: Location. Nothing within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jamesbooth
Reviews.Content: the staff at this hotel are among the best anywhere in the world, particulary betty casarez and chuck hernandez, on the front desk. these 2 people go above and beyond to help their customersand deserve recgonition and awards. just stay at their crown plaza and see for yourself, i challenge you. you wont be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Average 3 star hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Ayaghoubi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days a couple months ago. Overall the hotel is nice and the rooms are pretty spacious and clean and the price as you have probably seen is pretty reasonable. I go to Dallas several times a year and have tried many of the hotels around Market Center and would not recommend this one. The staff is very nice and helpful but I found the restaurant to be a very over priced dinner will probably run you around $50 for not so great food. All the equipment in the gym is all rusted because its in the same room as the pool. Overall its not a horrible hotel, I just find that there are several others close by within same price range that are better.

Reviews.Title: “staff issues”
Reviews.Author: bigbaldjohnny
Reviews.Content: i use a website that reports cheap rates to be had on priceline called betterbidding dot com - so I got a rate I was pleased with for crown plaza. It was a throw down weekend get away that was decide in haste on Friday afternoon for a midnight arrival that same day.h I was beat when I got to the checkin counter at 12:30AM - just wanted a shower and a compfy bed. First room was un made on 10th floor (back to the lobby for a another) second room was un made on the 14th floor, again back t the lobby, third time the charm. it was large aging room, old tv and had new bath and carpet, king bed with nice pillow top and linens. The air worked but not needed in February. The room was on the freeway side with an office park that rev'ed diesel engines ALL-NIGHT-LONG (wife says I snore louder) - but the shower was hot and nice and I was offered a free breakfast, - I'd give it another try as long as my room was on the back side. The common areas were nice, perhaps a bet squeezed and the parking and guest internet was free.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired & worn, nice if you like a cold shower.”
Reviews.Author: EnviroTravel
Reviews.Content: I'w writing this review on my second day of a three day stay. First day there was hot water in the shower, but not this morning. Although partially renovated, the furnishings and carpet are already showing their age. There is nothing nearby, so a car is needed. Nearest restaurants don't seem appealing at all. No morning newspaper, no free internet, and so far, hot water on just one day. There were a few excellent reviews of this property, they can't be believed. Its 3 stars at best, and in that category, it gets the stars only because it is spacious and probably once was a four star property with all the frills, but is sinking fast due to lack of daily upkeep, routine maintenance, and tender loving care.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for CHEAP CHEAP CHEAP!!!”
Reviews.Author: pi_99
Reviews.Content: I went to Priceline to name my own price after reading another post. I asked for a 3.5 Star around Dallas' Love Field for $35 and Crowne picked up! It was the best value I've ever gotten for a room! Great accommodations and service! Just a few miles North you can find great shopping outlets including Sam Moon- and within 5 miles to the South is Market Center. Easy access to I-35! GREAT VALUE! With the money we saved on the room, we ate downstairs in the restaurant. It was very expensive- BUT WORTH IT! The Wild Mushroom App was amazing! At this rate- I will return often! Even after taxes- it was under $50! Thanks for the tip!

Reviews.Title: “DUMP”
Reviews.Author: gowinsouls
Reviews.Content: This place was a dump, the rooms are very outdated, the air didn't work, when I called the front desk the phone rang 33 times before anyone answered...then they wanted to bring a man up to fix the air while we were in the room at almost 12:00 am!!!! Finally they moved us to another room on another level! We checked into our room looking for rest, instead we were treated like dirt and inconvenienced! NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: cokerbud
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit in the last couple of years to Crowne Plaza Market Center. It has most definitely improved over the years. I found the room to be excellent and also found that the employees have been retrained and are really great. They all are helpful and want to make your stay great. The ultimate test probably is I ordered room service at 10:50 P.M. when they close at 11:00 P.M. and it was no problem and they were happy to take care of me. The parking is free and well lighted and the property is located on the Stemmons Freeway making it easy to get downtown, to Market Center, Love Field,or the American Airlines Arena. I would definitely stay here again. They do have a nice bar and small restaurant, indoor pool, and the best fitness equipment around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for quick stay”
Reviews.Author: hapa_kolea
Reviews.Content: We stayed there recently for a concert and got a great rate on Priceline. Clean, free wireless and parking! Room and bathroom was clean. Only thing that I didnt like was the air cond. unit was on when we got to our room and it was FREEZING COLD! We turned it off but the floor was so cold to walk on with bare feet. As a result, the room turned muggy because it was so cold. Other than that, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay...good job!!”
Reviews.Author: vivace21
Reviews.Content: I will admit that when I read some of the reviews for this hotel I was a little bit nervous. I shouldnâ€™t have been. This was a good business hotel. I stayed for a three day conference and I was very satisfied. The rooms- I had a large room on the 10th floor in the corner. Very clean and comfortable. It was quiet and I did not hear a peep from either side of me. The bathroom had nice marble countertops. My room was cleaned promptly every morning. The bed was comfortable. The T.V. was older but that was not a big deal to me. Room service was prompt. The view was not so greatâ€¦the highway and a strip club. Restaurant and bar- I was pleasantly surprised. The food was really good! Everything I ordered was tasty. They have a lunch buffet for soup salad etc. Also good happy hour specials. Wait staff was attentive and nice. Location- My only real complaint about the place is where itâ€™s located. You canâ€™t walk to anything except a gas station. It is surrounded by busy highways and no restaurants or shopping or anything nearby. The highway is complex and hard to navigate. However the guy who operates the shuttle named Rinaldo is very nice and took my group to the mall and a bunch of other places. Be sure to tip him because he is awesome. If you fly into Love Field this would be a good place to stay, but forget it if you come in through DFW. Overall Service/Experience- The entire staff really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They are really trying hard and I noticed that. The conference rooms are good and well stocked with snacks, coffee, etc. Free internet!! The hotel is clean and well maintained. I was impressed with everything except the location, and they canâ€™t help that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - very near the airport, but not noisy.”
Reviews.Author: boandjill
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a nice hotel. My only complaint is that both printers in the business center were not working, so I could not print boarding passes for my flight out the next day. WIFI signal was very strong and very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mler13
Reviews.Content: A very nice upscale hotel. The rooms and bathrooms were very nice with granite counter-tops and crisp white bedding. They even give you a little sleeping kit with an eyemask, earplugs, and a lavender linen spray. Very near the highway but didn't seem too noisy. The staff was friendly and quick to respond when we had problems with our AC and even offered to move us to a new room if it didn't start working. The indoor pool is nice and they have a beautiful lobby. I also got a really good deal by getting them online.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Staff, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: DallasKaait
Reviews.Content: On July 2nd, we needed a room close to Love Field airport. I had been checking Expedia, and all of the usual internet sites for weeks hoping to find a decent rate on a nice hotel. All of the sites kept giving me $89.00 to $300.00 for the one night stay. I decided to try a low ball bid on Priceline.com., I put in a bid of $35.00 for a 3.5 star hotel near Love Field and Crown Plaza picked it up. Then I got to thinking perhaps they would give us one of their rooms that had not been upgraded yet. Boy was I ever surprised when we recieved one of the very best hotel rooms I have ever stayed in!! The room had been recently renovated. Everything from the hotel lobby to the room was spic and span clean. They even left lavender spray and eyewear on the bed. Our room had two of the most comfortable queen sized beds I have ever slept on. A full sized business desk with internet access. Granite countertops in the bathroom. Coffee pot . An absolutely gorgeous view of downtown Dallas. Free parking. The best staff I have seen at a hotel in quite some time. We had a nice dinner on the premises. The resturant was not busy at 8:30 PM preceeding a holiday, but the chef delivered our food to the table and exchanged plesantries with us for a few minutes. The food was scrumptious. I would call this more of a boutique hotel but for business travelers as well as leisure travelers. They offered shuttle service to locations within a 5 mile radius. Even at the rate of 120.00 per night, I would stay here again!! I could not find a single thing about this hotel that I didn't like.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timetravelers
Reviews.Content: My Wife & I Stayed at The Crowne Plaza Market Center for 2 Weeks in May and found the Reception and Management first Class Betty on Reception and Sal the Reception Manager always had time to ask us if we needed anything and all staff at reception offered us advice on where to visit locally our room on the 18th floor was very comfortable especially the beds we had the best nights sleep in any Hotel. Rooms cleaned every day but could have dusted as lights and under bed could do with a clean up bathroom good. as was the free internet access with printer attached on second floor very useful. Gym and Indoor Swimming pool good with free water and ice machines all round hotel there is a very small area at back to sunbathe but although this hotel is non smoking the smokers did use this area which did affect us as we do not smoke but as it was outsite nothing could be done there is free ample parking in hotel car park. The Hotel Restaurant was superb especially bobby the Chef he makes the best breakfast just ask him he will cook it fresh for you always smilling and happy and help yourself to the buffet, it is a bit on the pricey side but good. We had a good 2 weeks here although the weather rained quite a lot in the 2 weeks and was cloudy most of the time Visited Southfork where the series dallas was filmed Dallas Zoo was fantastic Kennedy Museum and shops it was Different

Reviews.Title: “Not the Greatest”
Reviews.Author: Deb0413
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Fort Worth for a sporting event and wanted to be closer to Love Field for our last night in town to have a short drive to the airport. That was the best part of this hotel, it was close to the airport. The room was very small and crowded with two beds (we reserved a king room). That was not such a big deal as it was only for one night and we would be gone early in the morning. When we started to get settled in our room we realized we did not have a TV remote, an alarm clock or a hair dryer. When I called the desk, I was told that none of the above were availible at that time and they would send them up if any were found. I then tried to use the automated system for a wake up call, I kept getting sent to the in room message center. I called the desk again to tell them that the system was not working, but they said they could set it from the front desk. I did not sleep thinking that the wake up call would not come, which it did about 15 minutes late. But in their defence the room, bed and bath were all clean and in good condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sportparent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while seeing family in Dallas. Easy location to get to all parts of town. Nice new rooms. Great staff that helped us out. They even have this computer in the lobby that gives us flight times. Will stay here next time we visit Big D.

Reviews.Title: “Meh - It's an Average Convention Hotel Showing its Age”
Reviews.Author: DeepUgh
Reviews.Content: This highrise hotel is located near downtown Dallas, but not in a gentrified neighborhood. You'll drive to go anywhere but the merchandise mart from here - but surface self-parking is free. Our room was acceptably clean but worn - the shower curtain had a suspicious brown clod of something on it and was too short for the new curved shower rod. The remote control for the TV had the batteries taped in, and the AC unit smelled musty. The hotel is non-smoking but the aroma of cigarettes lingered on in our room. Housekeeping did not service our room one of days of our stay. We returned late in the evening to an untouched room. I called the front desk for some towels, which never arrived. Video checkout was attempted, but was unavailable during the two hours I tried. Highlight? Free apples at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, but nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: tcm_crew
Reviews.Content: Convenient to IH-35 northbound, but if southbound, or coming from Mockinbird, you have to go IH-35 southbound to Commonwealth and U-turn under IH-35 on the service road to get to the hotel. I was on 6th floor and wanted something to drink from the vending machine, but the dollar bill accepter wasn't working - nor were the vending machines on 5th floor, 4th floor, or 3rd floor. I finally went to the desk after the 3rd floor vending machine took my first dollar, but not my second dollar, and then wouldn't return my first dollar. I asked the desk for change for a $20 and told them of the machine problems. I got $19 and 4 quarters. Uhh... cokes are $1.50 - four quarters won't cut it. I cut my losses and went to a grocery store and got some stuff to drink during my two-day stay. The hotel needs updating/renovation in the worst way. The look is very dark and drab. The elevators definitely have a moldy odor to them, which is occasionally mitigated by a good spray of Febreeze during the daily cleaning rounds. The rooms are very poorly lit. My room has two full-sized beds and is illuminted by one desk lamp, and two tablelamps, for a total of four of those new flouroescent bulbs. One end of the room remains depressingly dark, even with all lights on. The room is full enough with a TV/dresser, work desk, nightstand, and two beds, but then they add two sitting chairs and a table between them - and the room is just claustrophobically cramped. Housekeeping service can use some emphasis on attention to detail - when restocking my in-room coffee, I was left with one coffee amenity pack, instead of the usual two. Not a major, until I went for my 2nd cup of coffee this morning. The neighborhood around Mockingbird/IH-35 isn't the nicest part of town to be sure, so the parking lot security is a nice touch. You know it's a bad neighborhood when the hotel has blocked all but once of the vehicle entry points to the property. I'd definitely not leave anything worth over $10 in view in my vehicle here. All in all, not a bad place to stay if you got a good deal from Priceline or Hotwire (as I did), but if I'd paid the hotel's full rate, I'd be very, very dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Nice for Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: greengirl123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night expecting a completely renovated hotel with a nice view of the dallas city skyline. We were very pleased with the city view from a room that we stayed in on an upper floor of this 22 story hotel. As for the renovation, the hotel still appears very old and unrenovated once you go anywhere above the common areas of the first and second floors. We were unhappy with the old smell and 1970's looking carpet in the hallways, old unreplaced doors entering into the rooms, old air conditioning units and controls, size and quality of the bathroom fixtures in the room that was supposed to be a suite. On the up side, the front desk staff was very polite and helpful and the hotel and room did appear to be clean. Nice comfortable beds and bedding and the signature crowne plaza sleep package with spray and light sleeping music. Everything was clean except for the very dirty looking indoor hot tub which appeared to have some sort of dirty foamy soap on the top of the water. The elevators were not in top renovated condition either, appeared to be somewhat falling apart and made strange noises. Also, we know it was somewhat near downtown but there seem to be many questionable types of people staying in the hotel. Not the type I would like to run into in the parking lot at night. Hotel is okay if you are just looking for a clean place to stay for a night but not the best choice if you are looking for any type of luxury. Staff was wonderful but overall would rate this hotel at a 2 star quality. If you are going to do a multimillion dollar renovation why not take the time to make everything updated.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed”
Reviews.Author: aanettles
Reviews.Content: We reserved this room with Hotwire and got an excellent deal but I don't think that it should get the 3.5 star rating. The front desk help was very nice and helpful but they had Mexican music blaring in the background. The hotel was also doing a complete restoration but I think they missed the floor we stayed on. The room was little small with 2 full size beds. The bathroom was nice. The 25 inch TV could definitely be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Use Priceline.com!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey46
Reviews.Content: We bid $40 for one night and we got it. I'd say for what we paid this was an outstanding value. It is just a quick drive from downtown Dallas, however I can't say it's in the most scenic area. There were 3 strip clubs visible from our window (but they were across the interstate). It is nice staying in a smoke free hotel. The beds are very comfy. The hotel was quiet and we could not hear any of our neighbors. Check in/out was very easy and fast. I understand that the hotel is newly renovated, although our room (#1003) was showing signs of wear. The sink was missing the drain stop. There was some mildew. My bath towel had stains on it. The room was clean, but it didn't quite look like the photos on the website. It is NOT a 4 star. Definitely 3 star quality. But for what we paid, we got more than enough. I would never pay full price to stay here when there are other, nicer hotels asking the same price, but if you can get it for cheap on priceline.com like we did, it's definitely worth it. It's not a bad hotel, just not the pristine jewel that the hotel chain hopes it would be after the renovation. It's average.

Reviews.Title: “Just finishing their remodel and looking good!”
Reviews.Author: DavidandAngela
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the room, the breakfast buffet, the location, and the staff. Gee, that pretty well says it all. The Crowne Plaza is just nearing the finish line of their multi-million dollar remodeling. They warned us ahead of time but assured us that we'd love our stay. That we did! It is a very short walk from the front desk to the elevators. The elevators were quick throughout the weekend. (Hurray!) Our room was fresh, comfortable, and everything worked perfectly.The only things not replaced/refurbished were the door into the room and the thermostat controls. I was worried that perhaps the a/c or heat would not be up to par, but I was delighted to find that my fears were unfounded. I loved that every lamp in the room (four!) all had an extra electrical outlet on their bases making it easy to plug in my phone and PC chargers. Nice! The bathrooms have been redone with a nice shower head with consistent water temperatures. The bathrooms are not huge nor the tubs deep, but they are nice and have extras like curved shower curtain rods and double sinks. Towels were better than similar hotels, and amenities in the bathroom included mouthwash. (Nice extra touches!) Lighting was excellent (a pet peeve of mine in other hotels) and the room was quiet. I travel a LOT and this was the very first time that I received a thank you note from Housekeeping for the gratuity I left for them. (We stayed two nights). The beds were very comfortable and the sheets, blanket, and comforter were extra thick and nice. Some hotels make them so light and flimsy that we never feel "nested". Not here! Good pillows, and pillowcases that were actually soft. The breakfast buffet was really terrific. Great CRISP bacon without having to ask, and the usual spread put on by good hotels. The remodeled dining area was fresh, clean, and open. The hotel is just minutes (5) from Dallas' best "restaurant row". We loved our $$$$$ dinner at Pappa's Steakhouse but really enjoyed getting back to our room just 5 minutes later! There are MANY restaurants of all kinds and prices on the row and a fabulous 18 screen (stadium seating) movie theatre there to boot. We choose to watch "Bourne Ultimatum" in our room instead! Down sides: The parking lot is just "okay", but who cares? Don't be discouraged with the hotel's "curb appeal". You will love your stay! The nice indoor pool was very clean and "warm", but the hot tub, fitness rooms and adjoining restrooms are on the "tail end" of the remodel. They all worked, but just lacked the "freshness" of the rest of the hotel. I'm sure that these areas will be sensational in the months to come. Stay here. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Unethical hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kissiah
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at this hotel many months ago. I reserved a king/smoking room. When it came time for the trip, the hotel went to nonsmoking all over. Not only did they not inform me of the change, but then they refused to honor their own policy of either honoring the reservation or finding us comparable lodging elsewhere and paying for the first night's stay. This is both unethical and dishonorable. A phone call to the corporate office did no good at all. Evidently it is up to the hotel manager to tell corporate what they will or will not do. Bad business ethics does not get my business.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as nice as expected”
Reviews.Author: loidid
Reviews.Content: Booked this three night stay through Priceline. When our group arrived we found we had been given 3 rooms with King beds instead of 3 rooms with 2 double beds. After negotiation we received rollaway beds for each room (were told all the rooms were booked). Some of the nice aspects about staying there were: the rooms were spacious, with a comfortable bed and armchairs. They offered some extra amenities such as a free relaxation CD, linen bed spray and earplugs. There were two sinks and a make up mirror. All the rooms were close to the elevators. Upon arriving at the room, found there was no hotel guide or guest service directory, except for the room service menu. Had to call the front desk to get any information. A decorative pillow on the bed had something dried on it. We found the rollaway bed to take up too much room and on our way out the next morning requested that it be taken out. Upon arriving back at the end of the day, found that our room had not been touched that day. We called Front Desk and informed them. They said they would have adjusted our charge if we hadn't prepaid, and offered us free breakfast, which did us no good, as breakfast was included in our conference meals. We requested again that the bed be removed when someone brought up the clean towels. The towels were brought and the bed was left behind. The following day thankfully our room wasn't skipped. They finally took the bed. They left no liner for the bathroom trash and no new coasters for the water glasses. I considered using the workout machines on the first floor during the stay, but found that only 2 of the six machines were working, and were constantly in demand. All in all, while some of the amenities were nice, I would have enjoyed the stay more if the service had been better.

Reviews.Title: “Poor attitude”
Reviews.Author: Gearoid9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, my flight from DFW having been cancelled. Whilst realizing that staff were busy with an unexpected number of late-arriving guests, they were unfriendly and possessed a totally inappropriate attitude. For example, I had to ring reception three times over a two-hour period to get a guest services directory and functional remote for my room; each time I was brushed off. As other contributors have noted, the hotel is rather dark and drab, and the breakfast buffet is distinctly underwhelming. I would not recommend this hotel for a vacation, but it might suffice for a quick stop-over in an emergency.

Reviews.Title: “think hard about staying here”
Reviews.Author: kirbdog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business February 21, 2007. The staff did try to be friendly, the breakfast buffet was good. The property needs some serious upgrading. Drapes and carpets were torn, stained and generally dirty. Walls were knicked up and needed paint or repair. Pillows were terrible. I did not feel clean there. Wanted a Diet Coke before bedtime and gave up looking for a functional vending machine after 06 floors. Staffing in bar at night was insufficient. Not enough personnel on duty and nobody to assist the beleagured bartender. The location was convenient, but if you are with your spouse and using this as a place to stay for relaxation, dont' do it. It is in a bad part of town. I would not have stayed there if my wife was with me. Property was very noisy and I was awakened several times during the night by slamming doors and yelling and screaming. Vegas is quieter than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fliestovacay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night for a concert at American Airlines Center. The room was spacious, clean and had some nice touches: a sleep CD and lavender linen spray! No room is far from the elevator so you don't walk miles and miles. Parking was close and free, compared to other gigantic properties near here. We took Harry Hines Blvd south (the back way) right into the parking lot at AA center, about 1.5 miles and beat the traffic. This hotel is on the east feeder road of I-35 just south of Mockingbird Lane.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel which is conveniently situated on Stemmons Freeway (I-35) south of Mockingbird Lane about 12 miles from Dallas Airport (Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport) and 3 miles from Love Field Airport. The downtown government and financial districts are all situated within 6 minutes of the hotel. I had dinner at the Bristol Bar & Grill, which is located inside the hotel. The food was good. You can choose to order a variety of foods from the menu or just order the buffet. There is also an indoor swimming pool with a billiards table at the poolside. Adjacent to the pool is a fitness center. This area closes at 11:00 p.m. I was surprised to learn that this hotel is pet friendly, a nice accommodation for travelers traveling with pets. A complimentary newspaper was outside the room door every morning. The room itself has a coffee maker, alarm clock, iron and ironing board and comfortable, clean beds. There is a small area with a table and two chairs. Plenty of closet and dresser drawer space for clothes. Being so close to the freeway, I was pleasantly surprised to have found the room quiet. I have no complaints about the hotel itself. However, if you are on foot, there are no restaurants or stores within walking distance from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two Many Miles For This”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel while visiting for a Cowboys game on Sept 19 thru 20,2005.Rooms needed to be cleaned,dirty carpet with spots,one bed needed to be fixed broken down,breakfast made to order egg omlets very high in cost.Enter room with people still sleeping in there beds.Door knob/handle fell off when answering door for house keeping finally arrived.No favorite surronding eating places within walking/driving distant.Will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but needs work”
Reviews.Author: RedSpyder
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the best of neighborhoods nor is it in the best of condition. You can see the efforts at renovation which are nice - new bed, new radio, etc. but they left out things that ruin the overall effect, such as patches in the bathtub porcelin, curtains that are dingy and tattered along the edges, stained carpet, etc. On the plus side, the service in the bar and restaurant was great (the front desk service was limited by it being a constant employee meeting spot) and the workout room is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was wonderful!! Very friendly. Rooms were clean with some extras. Good work out area. We will stay there again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “A Steal on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: av8trix2
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is on Stemmons Fwy, a short 6 minute drive to downtown. I was attending a conference at the Adam's Mark but didn't want to pay our reduced rate of $115 plus $12 for parking, especially after reading that the rooms weren't all that great. So, I went on Priceline and bid $45 for a 3 star hotel and Crowne Plaza accepted the bid. I checked in and the front desk staff was really friendly. They checked me into a corner room with a king size bed and non-smoking on a high floor, as I called and requested. Unfortunately, I was called around 8 PM and told I had to change rooms...the one I was in was blocked off and I was put there by mistake. I had just ordered room service and they offered to pick up the tab and buy me breakfast in their restaurant. Not bad. Now for the bad stuff...the second room wasn't nearly as clean as the first. I was on the 19th floor and my new room (same location--corner room) had the added bonus of elevator noise. I called to complain but nothing was done about it. Every time the elevator moved you could hear it. Pretty annoying, but that's really as bad as it got. Crowne plaza has gotten new beds, and they give you a sleep mask, ear plugs, a CD for relaxation, and lavender spray for the sheets as part of a new "sleep better" program. Wireless internet was 4.95 a day, 9.95 a week; pretty reasonable compared to other hotels I've stayed at. Parking here is free! The breakfast buffet resembles Embassy Suites...made to order eggs, pancakes, waffle, etc. Room service was just okay. I highly recommend the Crowne Plaza, based on my room rate. If it was the normal rate of $100+ you could expect to pay here, I'd rate it as average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexandriava
Reviews.Content: Nice room, bed, room service fast and good. Enjoyed "sleep package" - used linen spray provided at other hotels on business trip!

Reviews.Title: “The Crown Fool of the chain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Six Continent chain hotel is the worst of their properties, which is a shame because it does not need to be. The amenities described in the hotel description are, in many cases, false or misleading. Their room service is a joke, there are no real concierge services nor a real business center and the rooms are dated and in disrepair. A serious renovation is needed before this one would be worth a visit at any price!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The management of this hotel need to wake up! They are very non-responsive to business travellers. I missed the last order for dinner by 10 minutes when arriving from the UK. There was nothing they could do. Then I could not even order a drink to my room. Fortunately the bar person "allowed" me to get one drink from the bar. Needless to say - I will not be staying there again!

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Dallas Market Center
HotelInfo.Address: 7050 N Stemmons Frwy, Dallas, TX 75247
